description.narrative: Tete Rural Electrification Project Agreement is under the overall agreement of Sofala Manica Tete (A2300075_51140042 El: Sofala, Manica, Tete) that on 1 April 2004 and ended 30 June 2016. The total amount of the contribution is MSEK 46. Noting that the first payment was only in 2012. The overall agreement consisted of three separate contributions namely; Sofala Manica Tete Rural Electrification, Chibabava Buzi Rural Electrification and Tete Expansion. The purpose of this contribution is to electrify Tete specifically but the results are difficult to separate from the other two contributions as projects' activities, financial account and reporting are intertwined. Tete city was undergoing rapid expansion as a result of several mining developments. The demand for power, to establish new expansions areas are increasing as well as to support new infrastructure developments to cater for present and future expansion.The network needs to be reinforced in the following areas around Tete City; Josina Machel, Filipe Samuel Magaia, Mateus Sansao Mutemba, Francisco Manhanga and Samora Machel. Based on the assumed needs of power in Tete City and the limitation of funds, the priority was to construct new main distribution lines and upgrade distribution transformers to at least overcome the actual demand of power in the above mentioned prioritized areas. The total construction scope of work of this part under the Sofala Manica Tete Project concerning Tete City consisted of: • Construction of 800m of 66/33kV double circuit Over Head Transmission Line (OHTL)• Construction of 19 km of Mid Voltage (MV) Over Head Line (OHL) 33kV.• Installation of 1x160kVA, 11x250kVA, 11x315kVA, 3 x 500kVA distribution transformers, (KVA= KiloVoltAmpere)• Construction of 50 km of L V OHL 0,4 kV network, (KV=KiloVolt)• Connection of 2200 new consumers. The project objectives were achieved to the extent that of existing distribution network in medium voltage and low voltage was expanded within Tete City and surrounding rural areas, hence to provide quality and more reliable and trustworthy electrical power supply to both existing and new consumers.
Att möta efterfrågan på elektricitet för att stödja den ekonomiska och sociala utvecklingen i Moçambique.
To support economic and social development of Mozambique through meeting the demand for electricity.

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: As overall conclusion, the project contributed extensively to strengthen the network within Tete City and surrounding areas, with construction of new lines and reinforcing existing ones, implementation of new distribution transformers as well as upgrading existing transformers. The distribution network in medium and low voltage was reinforced and expanded at all planed areas, namely Josina Machel, Filipe Samuel Magaia, Mateus Sansao Mutemba, Francisco Manhanga and Samora Machel. The project focused on reinforcing and upgrading the existing lines with much bigger size conductors, hence increasing as well the expansion of capabilities of the network. Distribution transformers were installed in above mentioned areas as well, at strategically selected locations where growth of population demanded supply of electricity. It should be noted that the contract signed included 1685 connection, less than the project's objective of 2200 connections. This is caused by the long delays and time it took between the project inception to the actual implementation. In some of areas where the project was suppose to be implement, EdM had already anticipated with the expansion of the network and started constructing the network not awaiting the uncertain start of the project. It is unclear what caused the delays due to the long time since the ending of project activities and closure of the project. Records show that some delays caused by unaccepted technical investigations of sites and other contractual related technicalities. In addition, the total quantity of distribution network planned for in the original contract bill of quantities was not achieved. Only 900 service connections were executed versus the 1685 service connections initially foreseen on the contract. This quantity represents services connections performed for the new consumers and existing consumers with bad connections that required improvements. The available funds were then used for upgrading some of the existing distribution transformers (PTs) within Tete City instead due to overloading of the transformers there.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
